html: Cockfighting is currently prohibited by federal law in all fifty states and D.C. However, ambiguous language in the law allows U.S. territories to skirt the prohibition & continue to allow cockfighting, which remains popular in some territories. html: SNAP asset tests have not been updated since the 1970s. The Farm Bill raises asset limits so participants can put away more in a savings account or own a higher value car w/o it affecting eligibility. These are needed improvements to put people in a better position to succeed.pic.twitter.com/rvihwVdsPI
text: SNAP asset tests have not been updated since the 1970s. The Farm Bill raises asset limits so participants can put away more in a savings account or own a higher value car w/o it affecting eligibility. These are needed improvements to put people in a better position to succeed.pic.twitter.com/rvihwVdsPI

html: Some SNAP asset tests haven’t been updated since the 1970s and that has limited the ability of beneficiaries to put money into savings or own a car. The Farm Bill modernizes the asset tests and raises thresholds so not every nickel of every asset counts against eligibility.pic.twitter.com/8k0ieJbPq2
text: Some SNAP asset tests haven’t been updated since the 1970s and that has limited the ability of beneficiaries to put money into savings or own a car. html: New York’s business climate is one of the worst in the nation. New York residents continue to flee seeking lower taxes and more jobs. In his State of the State, I hope Gov. Cuomo recognizes the need to reverse this trend.

html: New York is the only state in the U.S. to still have a law like the “Scaffold Law.” My bill allows projects using federal funding to utilize the same standard as every other state. Every federal dollar will go further for NY infrastructure projects. http://bit.ly/2A8zfzD
